docs.snippet: In obedience to a call signed by N. BARRETT, Chairman of the Quarantine Committee, a meeting. not large but composed of influential persons, was held at the Court House in Richmondl on Tuesday a'. ternoon, at3 o'clock.. The meeting was called to...
docs.lead_paragraph: In obedience to a call signed by N. BARRETT, Chairman of the Quarantine Committee, a meeting. not large but composed of influential persons, was held at the Court House in Richmondl on Tuesday a'. ternoon, at3 o'clock.. The meeting was called to order at 3,1/2 P. M., by Judge CROPSEY; and Dr. Jto. T. HARRIEO:, formerly Health Officer. was appointed Chairman, and H.M. BEOHM, Esq., Secretary.

docs.snippet: The screw.steams`ip Kangaroo, from Liver. pool at 10 o'clock on the morning of the 13th of Janucry, arrived at this port last evening. The steamship Fulton was to leave Southampton for New-York on the day the Kangaroo sailed.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; Continued Success in Launching the Leviathan. Several Windham's Reported Defeat Contradicted, Consols Unchanged--Cotton Quiet--Breadstuffs Dull. Gen.Havelock's Death Confirmed ARRIVAL OF TnlE KANGAROO, NO NEWS OF THE ARIEL. Further from India and China.

headline.main: MASSACHUSETTS.; The Corruption Witnesses-Quiney's Memoir of J. Q. Adams--Mr. Blair's Speech--The Representative System -- The offices--Change of Official Organ -- Suffering from Poverty--The Suhriness of the Weather--The Failure of the Ice Crop, and the Evil Thereof--Death of Judge Kinnicutt and Mr. Hathaway.

docs.lead_paragraph: The messenger to find witnesses in tile corruption case arrived here last Friday, and commence business. Some of the persons he was after he. found, but others "turned up nissing,"not that they ran away from him, but that they left the country before anything had been said about the corruptions that have caused so much grief to the virtuous souls at the national capitsl.

headline.main: RACHEL.; Early History--Dramatic Career--Anecdotes--Letters--Debut in New-York.

docs.lead_paragraph: RACHEL was the title by which the great Tragedienne was usually known. Were her full cognemen given, it would be ELIZABETH RACHEL FELIX. No record of her birth exists, save that she saw light in a wretched Swiss tavern. Her parents were specimens of that nomadic tribe of Israelites who go about the world, gipsy-like, finding a living by any means promising the return of a pittance.

headline.main: Interesting Information from the Utah Expedition.; COL. COOK' REPORT.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEAR MAJOR : I left you on Black's Fork, 16 miles from Fort Bridlger, on the 7th ins ant, after one (lay's march from the point of uniting the commands by Col. JOHNNSTON. You now find us in this camp, named in honor of our cherished chief, whose forthought and action has placed us in winter-quarters, under excellent shelter, without the blow of an axe.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE EUROPA.; IMPORTANT FINANCIAL NEWS. Discount Reduction by the Banks of England, Prussia, Belgium and Turin. Successful Progress of the Leviathan's Launch. IMPROVEMENT IN TRADE THROUGHOUT EUROPE, IMPORTANT FROM INDIA. Deaths of Rachel, Marshal Radetzky and the Grand Vizier of Turkey. Repulse of the British near Cawnpore, and Subsequent Defeat of the Rebels by Sir Colin Campbell. ONE WEEK LATER FROM EUROPE. Death of Gen. Havelock from Dysentery

docs.snippet: THE WEATHER during the past week was as pleasant and unseasonable as ever. People afflicted with weak lungs were not sorry; but those who enjoy good health would generally prefer the bracing cold weather at this time of the year.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE WEATHER during the past week was as pleasant and unseasonable as ever. People afflicted with weak lungs were not sorry; but those who enjoy good health would generally prefer the bracing cold weather at this time of the year.

docs.snippet: The twenty eighth anniversary of this Society was celebrated in the First Reformed Dutch Church last evening. After the usual opening exercises, the annual report and the Treasurer's report were read. From the former we take the following statistics:...

headline.main: LONG ISLAND.; Twenty-eighth Anniversary of the Brooklyn City Tract Society.

docs.lead_paragraph: The twenty eighth anniversary of this Society was celebrated in the First Reformed Dutch Church last evening. After the usual opening exercises, the annual report and the Treasurer's report were read. From the former we take the following statistics: Missionaries employed ........................... 5 Visiters ............................................436 Tracts distributed in public institutions ....... 33,945 Tracts distributed among seamen ............. 24,338 Tracts distributed in the city .......................251,451 Childs' Paper .............................................. 24,000
